request_pathways.name: Request for Release of Information Form

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: A single generic ROI form with 'Patient' as one checkbox option under 'Release Records To,' used for all release purposes.

red_flags: HIPAA law name cited incorrectly as 'Health Information Portability and Accountability Act' instead of 'Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act'
Form dated 8/1/2017 — over 8 years old with no apparent updates
bright_spots: First 10 pages free, reducing cost burden for routine patient access
Single-page form efficiently covers all ROI requirements
'Complete Health Record' checkbox simplifies full-record requests
Explicit anti-conditioning language with HIPAA § 164.508 citation

findability.rationale: Level 3: Form found via basic web search (easy retrieval) but not linked from the organization's patient forms page — a patient browsing the website would not discover it through normal navigation.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite workflow, but fax submission is available (two fax numbers listed), meeting the threshold for 'fax submission available' at this level.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Logical top-to-bottom flow and efficient single-page design, but dense legal paragraphs in small font, staff-use fields ('Release completed by', 'MR #') on the patient-facing form, and cramped layout create notable clarity issues.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the form (with 'Patient' checkbox and inspection option), but it is a generic ROI authorization not designed for patient self-access; patients must figure out which fields apply to them versus third-party recipients.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Reasonable fees with first 10 pages free, explicit anti-conditioning language, patient rights mentioned, no notarization required; minor issues (HIPAA name error, calendar-year expiration, no patient-access fee distinction) are ambiguities that do not materially impede access.

overall.summary: Phelps Memorial provides a functional single-page ROI form with patient-friendly fees, but the non-fillable design, absence from website navigation, and generic third-party-oriented form place it in the middle tier for patient self-access.
